entries.journal_entry_description: You've found some splinters of what appears to be a larger crystal. When you came close to some other splinters, the ones you had started pulsing and making a humming noise. As soon as you found the new splinters and put them together, they stopped. They all seem to have been part of the same crystal.
entries.task02_message_box_text: All of a sudden the now familiar vibrations and humming sounds from the crystal splinters in your backpack start again...
entries.task03_journal_entry_description: The crystal splinters started making a noise in this area again. Maybe there's more fragments somewhere around here.
entries.task05_message_box_text: All of a sudden the now familiar vibrations and humming sounds from the crystal splinters in your backpack start again...
entries.task06_journal_entry_description: The crystal splinters started making a noise in this area again. Maybe there's more fragments somewhere around here.

entries.task09_journal_entry_description: The crystal splinters started making a noise in this area again. Maybe there's more fragments somewhere around here.
entries.task11_message_box_text: All of a sudden the now familiar vibrations and humming sounds from the crystal splinters in your backpack start again...
entries.task12_journal_entry_description: The crystal splinters started making a noise in this area again. Maybe there's more fragments somewhere around here.
entries.task13_journal_entry_description: It seems like the crystal splinters can sense when they are near more splinters from their original crystal. The missing splinters could be anywhere though. From looking at the pieces you have, you guess that there is at least four pieces missing.
entries.task14_message_box_text: Looking at the pieces of crystal you have collected, it seems like you have all the ones it would take to reunite a symmetrical shard. How do you fuse crystal back together though?
